function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of housing stability increases the risk of covid-19 infection, transmission, illness, and death","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the impact of remote work and online activities on mental and social wellbeing.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of guidelines for residential buildings’ resilience to covid-19","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate social and spatial framework for collective housing","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient role of architects in the resilience process","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness and capacity to learn from past experiences","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Grounding housing fund construction on socialist principles","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transition from self-managing socialism to neoliberal capitalism","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Privatization of spatial and economic resources","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decision to buy land for agricultural purposes and real estate outside the city","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to self-isolate in common areas of the building","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient state policies related to housing strategies in response to covid-19","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social isolation leading to risks of anxiety, depression, and premature mortality","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper maintenance of green areas leading to the spread of contagious diseases such as vector-borne illnesses","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in multi-purpose urban gardens","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of remote work environment safety measures in multi-purpose urban gardens","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased density and social interaction leading to higher risk of disease transmission in the residential area","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shared common spaces for socialization may become hotspots for disease transmission if not properly managed and maintained.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greening of flat roofs and creation of urban gardens may introduce new disease vectors and require careful management to prevent the spread of infectious diseases.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Accessibility via stairs limits access for individuals with mobility restrictions, increasing the risk of excluding this group from the space.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density in urban areas increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Loss of community and engagement within the building","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited application of guidelines may lead to inadequate disease mitigation measures in residential buildings.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to common areas in dense urban areas may hinder the implementation of disease mitigation measures.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lower application rate of the resilient residential model may result in suboptimal disease resilience during the pandemic and beyond.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of access to nature and outdoor spaces in residential buildings","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Abandonment of earlier housing concepts","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shortcomings of existing housing stock becoming more noticeable","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overproduction of residential buildings due to market policy","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduction in goods solely viewed through market value","category":"Business","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Affirmative attitude towards residential space leading to complacency","category":"Participation","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid dissemination of new diseases and elevated risk of pandemics","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid mutation of microorganisms and adaptation as a cause of human diseases","category":"Organizations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Methods applied should be non-life threatening, user friendly, and energy efficient","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No significance found in the effect of age and gender on droplet generation, potentially leading to underestimation of transmission risk in different demographic groups","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Variability in pathogen infectivity due to virulence, pathogen generation, and infective dose","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of pathogens in the air based on environmental factors like air temperature and relative humidity","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Influence of relative humidity on pathogenic bacteria and viruses","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Transmission of influenza a virus dependent on relative humidity","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Effect of humidity on virus survival","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positive and negative influence of temperature on virus survival","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influenza virus transmission is more effective at lower temperatures, such as 5 c, compared to higher temperatures like 20 c or 30 c","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses may have different survival patterns at different temperatures compared to non-enveloped viruses","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Public health interventions may not be sufficient to stop disease outbreaks in modern society, according to mathematical models","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adverse health effects of uvgi on humans","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inconsistent information disclosure about the pandemic","category":"Accountability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conflicting political views on pandemic response and impact","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective technical systems for coordinated public policies","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear evidence on the best efficiency models for decision-making processes","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to take advantage of new technologies for implementing innovative governance models","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"}]}
